FOUND IN: Agile - Having or showing quick and nimble movements or actions
Gobi - A vast desert region in northern China and southern Mongolia.
Exile - The act of forcing someone to leave their country or home, often as a punishment.
Slumber Party Essentials (Though not directly referring to overnight activities, it includes items used in such settings)
Toughen - Become tougher or more robust, either physically or emotionally.
Dismantled - taken apart, disassembled into component parts.
Actor (as he was also an actor, though not the author of 'The Vicar of Wakefield')
White spaces - blank areas on a page or screen with no text or graphics
Fidel Castro: The most prominent Cuban revolutionary and communist politician who served as the President of Cuba from 1976 to 2008.
